channel.title: Help please
channel.description:
I came back after a 8 month brake from RSPS's and I wanna re-learn everything I missed out and forgot on. I downloaded a source and stuff but I can't seem to remember and quite get it on :/ I forgot what to do. I know their's something with server > Run/Compile to your JDK Version and idk rest. Some one please help me out and be a gentlemen? Thanks. (Contact me by Skype please)
Skype: qarrots

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @garywieder03 garywieder03
item.description:
@garywieder03 wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:5, topic:524818”][quote author=garywieder03 link=topic=643505.msg4331681#msg4331681 date=1373735252]

If you’re looking for a team, use the Development Teams section.

Otherwise, if you need specific help on an issue, post the problems on this thread.
[/quote]Lol read.

I’m pretty sure I did. Before your post edit, you said you were looking for people to create a server with. Post what your problems are with running the server. Don’t expect to be spoonfed (although I see that the poster above already attempted to do so).[/quote] Yea but it’s mainly a help post and a P.S. for quote/message to anyone. So you’re wrong. Please don’t reply bacl

Read full topic

I’m pretty sure I did. Before your post edit, you said you were looking for people to create a server with. Post what your problems are with running the server. Don’t expect to be spoonfed (although I see that the poster above already attempted to do so).

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @tgm_clan tgm clan
item.description:
@tgm_clan wrote:

Change the ip on your client by going to your client files > client.java and search for

127.0.0.1
or
server.equals
. If it has a number ip for example 48.34.24.231 change it to 127.0.0.1 if its 127.0.0.1 just keep it. That ip will allow you only on your server. When u want to turn it on, change the 127.0.0.1 to a no-ip ip that you have made. Now go to gui.java (still in your client files) and you will see a ip within your notepad with out scrolling down. Still, if its 127.0.0.1 keep it that till you want to turn it on. Now to jdk open up “my computer” > c drive > program files (or program files x86) > java > that finds your jdk version. Now to change it go into your source > compiler > right click it > edit and change the jdk version to your jdk version (not all runs/compilers use jdk, some use jre) and do the same for the run.bat in your source and the compiler.bat , and run.bat in your client files. Hoped this helped you

Read full topic
